title: Overheats at Idle but Cools While Driving (Fan/Airflow Issue)
symptom_short: Temp rises at stop/idle; drops when moving

likely_causes.notes: Most common when overheating mainly at idle.
Low coolant reduces heat transfer and can cause spikes.

recommended_checks: Confirm fans run when engine is hot or A/C is ON.
Check fuses/relays and fan connector for corrosion/heat damage.
Inspect radiator fins for blockage (bugs/leaves/plastic bag).
Check coolant level when cold; look for leaks and dried coolant residue.
safety_warning: Overheating can damage head gasket/engine quickly. Stop driving if temp is in the red or steam appears.

title: Overheats at Highway Speeds (Flow Restriction)
symptom_short: Runs hotter at speed; may be stable at idle

likely_causes.notes: Old coolant, contamination, or stop-leak can clog cores.
Some pumps lose blades or slip on shaft.

recommended_checks: Look for uneven radiator temperature (hot/cold spots) with safe method.
Check for heater performance changes at higher RPM.
Inspect coolant condition (rust/sludge).
Verify thermostat operation and water pump health.
safety_warning: Sustained highway overheating can warp cylinder head and destroy engine.

title: Coolant Leak — Visible Puddle / Sweet Smell
symptom_short: Puddle under car; sweet odor; low coolant

likely_causes.cause: Hose/clam p leak (upper/lower radiator hose, heater hoses)
likely_causes.notes: Common with aged rubber and weakened clamps.
Often leaves crusty coolant trail near pump.

likely_causes.cause: Coolant reservoir crack or cap failure

recommended_checks: Locate leak source: look for dried crusty residue (white/green/orange).
Pressure test cooling system if tools available.
Check radiator cap and reservoir cap seals.
Inspect water pump area for wetness around weep hole.
safety_warning: Do not open radiator cap when hot. Coolant can spray and cause severe burns.

title: Coolant Loss with No Visible Puddle (Hidden/Internal Leak)
symptom_short: Coolant keeps dropping but no obvious leak

likely_causes.cause: Heater core leak (may fog windows / wet carpet)

likely_causes.notes: Look for white smoke, misfire, milky oil, bubbles in reservoir.

likely_causes.cause: Evaporation from small leak only under pressure/heat

recommended_checks: Check passenger floor for dampness and sweet smell (heater core).
Look for white smoke from exhaust and sweet odor.
Check oil for milky appearance; check coolant for oil film.
Pressure test and use UV dye to find small leaks.
safety_warning: Internal coolant leaks can cause sudden overheating and engine damage.

title: Coolant Boils/Overflows from Reservoir
symptom_short: Reservoir bubbling; coolant pushes out after driving

likely_causes.cause: Overheating due to fan/thermostat/water pump/radiator issues
Combustion gases entering coolant (head gasket/cracked head)
likely_causes.notes: Often continuous bubbles and rapid pressurization.

recommended_checks: Check for fan operation and coolant level.
Test radiator cap (replace if seal weak).
Look for continuous bubbling from cold start (possible combustion gas).
Perform block test (combustion leak test) if available.
safety_warning: Do not drive if it’s boiling/overflowing; severe engine damage can happen quickly.

title: Engine Runs Too Cool (Thermostat Stuck Open)
symptom_short: Takes too long to warm up; weak heat; poor MPG

likely_causes.notes: Common with P0128 in many vehicles.

likely_causes.cause: Coolant temperature sensor reading low incorrectly

recommended_checks: Scan for P0128 and compare live coolant temp vs gauge.
Feel upper radiator hose from cold start: if it warms too early, thermostat may be open.
Replace thermostat with OEM-quality part.
safety_warning: Running too cool increases engine wear and emissions over time.

title: Thermostat Stuck Closed (Rapid Overheat)
symptom_short: Heats up fast; upper hose stays cool; little/no circulation

likely_causes.notes: Some cars trap air and overheat quickly.

recommended_checks: Do not continue driving once temp climbs rapidly.
Confirm coolant level and proper bleeding procedure.
Replace thermostat and gasket if stuck suspected.
safety_warning: Rapid overheating can damage engine in minutes.

title: No Cabin Heat + Overheating (Possible Low Coolant/Airlock)
symptom_short: Cabin heat is cold while engine temp rises
symptom_patterns: heater blows cold and temp high

likely_causes.cause: Air trapped in heater core/cooling system

recommended_checks: Check coolant level when cold and look for leaks.
Follow correct bleeding procedure for the vehicle.
Check for circulation in reservoir/return hose (varies by design).
safety_warning: If overheating, stop driving; using heater as a temporary trick is not a real fix.

title: Radiator Hose Collapses / Sucks Flat
symptom_short: Lower hose collapses; overheating or poor flow

likely_causes.cause: Weak hose with missing internal spring (lower hose)
likely_causes.notes: Lower hose often needs a spring to prevent collapse.

recommended_checks: Inspect hose condition and confirm spring presence (if design uses one).
Replace hose if soft or deformed.
Check/replace radiator cap if vacuum valve suspected.
safety_warning: Restricted flow can cause overheating under load.

title: Coolant Temperature Sensor Fault (Gauge Erratic / Fan Issues)
symptom_short: Gauge jumps; fans behave oddly; codes present

likely_causes.cause: Coolant temperature sensor failure or wiring issue
likely_causes.notes: Some cars run fans full speed as fail-safe.

recommended_checks: Scan codes and compare live temp reading to actual warm-up behavior.
Inspect sensor connector for green corrosion or coolant contamination.
Check wiring for rub-through near engine.
safety_warning: False readings can hide real overheating or trigger unnecessary limp strategies.

title: Cooling Fan Runs Constantly (Even When Cold)
symptom_short: Fans stay on; possible sensor/control fault
symptom_patterns: cooling fan runs all the time

likely_causes.cause: PCM/BCM control issue or A/C pressure sensor fault

recommended_checks: Check for ECT codes and verify temp reading.
Swap fan relay with identical relay for test.
Check A/C pressure sensor readings if fan behavior changes with A/C.
safety_warning: Constant fan operation can drain battery and indicates an underlying fault.

title: Radiator Cap Failure (Low Pressure, Overheat, Coolant Loss)
symptom_short: Coolant loss, boiling, or overheating with no obvious cause

likely_causes.cause: Cap seal worn; cap not holding pressure

recommended_checks: Inspect cap seal for cracks and spring tension.
Replace cap with correct pressure rating.
Retest for overflow/boiling.
safety_warning: Never remove cap hot; wait until completely cool.

title: Head Gasket Suspected (Overheat + White Smoke + Coolant Loss)
symptom_short: Overheats; coolant loss; white smoke; misfires

likely_causes.cause: Head gasket failure allowing combustion gas into coolant
likely_causes.notes: Can pressurize system quickly and push coolant out.

recommended_checks: Check for continuous bubbles in reservoir from cold start.
Perform combustion leak (block) test and cooling system pressure test.
Check spark plugs for steam-cleaned appearance on one cylinder.
Compression/leak-down test if available.
safety_warning: Continuing to drive can destroy the engine and cause sudden overheating.
